summary: T. Jeremy Gunn was a member of the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB). His role involved overseeing the review and declassification of JFK assassination records, ensuring compliance with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act. He was involved in correspondence with the CIA, the Department of State, and other agencies regarding the release of information, particularly concerning foreign government information and liaison relationships. Gunn also participated in discussions regarding the declassification of specific records, such as Joseph Califano's Army papers and Joint Staff/JCS records, as well as the handling of the Yuriy Nosenko case. He was involved in formal determinations regarding the public disclosure of CIA records related to the JFK assassination. The documents span from 1994 to 1998, indicating his active involvement during the ARRB's operational period. A notable pattern is his consistent engagement with the CIA and other government entities to facilitate the declassification and release of JFK assassination-related documents.
significance: T. Jeremy Gunn's significance lies in his role as a member of the ARRB, actively involved in the declassification and release of JFK assassination records. He played a crucial part in ensuring government agencies complied with the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act, contributing to the public's access to information related to the assassination.
